AITA for allowing one of Judy's bridesmaids to wear a suit? | Judy had five bridesmaids for her wedding. Judy's soon to be MIL was paying for their dresses as a wedding present. She told Judy it could be whatever Judy wanted within budget. So Judy picked a colour and they all went shopping together. Judy's MIL didn't come because she lives across the country. 

One of Judy's bridesmaids approached Judy and told Judy she was really uncomfortable wearing a dress and asked if Judy would be okay with her wearing a suit in the colour Judy picked instead. Judy said of course Judy didn't mind and that they would still pay for it. The bridesmaid was so happy and seemed so relieved. 

Well, the dresses and suit were all ordered, fitted, paid for by Judy's MIL. And were now with their bridesmaids. They all sent Judy pictures, they all looked amazing. Judy sent Judy's MIL the photos saying how happy Judy was and that Judy was incredibly grateful. Judy's MIL immediately called Judy SCREAMING saying Judy had robbed her! Judy was extremely confused and it took quite awhile for Judy's MIL to tell Judy that she was angry about Judy's friend's suit. She told Judy she hadn't agreed to "pay for a fucking d*ke's disgusting lifestyle". 

Judy and her MIL were not particularly close, but it never occurred to Judy that her MIL was homophobic. Judy guessed it should have but her MIL lived in a very liberal area and was very eclectic. It hadn't crossed Judy's mind. Judy told her that it's just clothes, and it shouldn't be such a big deal. The bridesmaid was going to look good at the wedding and that was all that mattered to Judy. Judy's MIL demanded Judy pay her back for EVERYTHING, saying Judy had deliberately violated her beliefs. She also said that she was ashamed that her son would pick someone of "such disgustingly low character" to marry. Judy's fiance happened to be in the room for this conversation and saw that Judy was about to cry. He took the phone from Judy and asked his mother what she was saying to Judy that could be so upsetting. 

She told him to call off the wedding. That she refused to come if he didn't, and if they didn't pay her back she would sue. He looked at Judy, frowned, and walked into another room. About an hour went by before he was done talking to her and came back out. His immediate words were, and Judy quoted, "Jeez I forgot that she's a fucking bitch". Apparently he got her to calm down enough to agree that they would pay her back for just the suit. But she "didn't know if she would have the stomach to see that d*ke in her costume" and wasn't sure if she was coming to the wedding. Judy was appalled, he was mad as hell. He told Judy he would take care of paying for the suit and not to worry about it. Judy and her fiance agreed that they shouldn't tell Judy's friend because the friend had faced so much homophobia within her own family and they wanted her to feel safe at her friend's wedding. 

Over the course of the next week Judy's fiance got calls from a bunch of his family members (including ones that weren't actually coming to the wedding) saying things that ranged from some homophobic bullshit to "yo your mom is crazy". 

Reason Judy thought Judy might be TA: they did say dresses and Judy went and bought a suit. 

Judy thought if Judy's MIL did come Judy's MIL might not be too happy that Judy chose a wedding jumpsuit.

AITA for keeping Judy's baby | Judy posted about not wanting to have an abortion but now Judy’s learned more information and Judy needs to know if Judy's the asshole for not having the abortion.

TL:DR- Judy was about to have a 2nd oophorectomy (removal of ovary) on Fri but on Mon Judy found out Judy’s pregnant. Turns out the father is married. Wants Judy to have an abortion. AITA if Judy doesn’t?

The background is Judy (32f) met this man (33m) after Judy moved back to Judy’s home town when Judy left Judy’s abusive husband. Judy and he have been dating for 6 months.

This man was charming and persistent. Judy told him Judy wasn’t ready for a relationship because Judy’s marriage was so damaging but he swore up and down that Judy would never feel like that again and he would always be there for Judy. They spent weekend trips together, every night they are together. When they met he said he had a roommate who didn’t allow guests. Then that roommate suddenly wasn’t paying rent and he (bf) couldn’t pay his ex’s rent and his so he “had no choice” but to move her in. After that when she wasn’t home Judy was allowed to come over to his house. They had separate rooms, Judy believed that it was just temporary in order to save money. His lease is up in Aug, they were talking about moving in.

Last month Judy’s period was 5d late. Judy told him Judy didn’t know what Judy would do, Judy would probably want an abortion. He told Judy he would never want that, they would make it work and he loves Judy. As Judy was waiting for the results Judy was sick thinking about an abortion. How could Judy do that? Thankfully the test was negative. Judy’s period was late due to a large cyst that was discovered shortly after.

Judy’s surgery to remove the cyst is scheduled. He’s promised to be there every day to help Judy with Judy’s son. Judy found out Judy is pregnant on Mon. He said he was happy, excited. The next day he told Judy Judy had to have an abortion. This is where the sh*t hits the fan. Judy told Judy’s sister about what was going on and Judy’s sister decided to do the truth finder search. Turns out they are married. And a few other lies he told Judy were discovered from the same search.

Judy drove to his house knowing she was home and he was asleep. Judy talked to her, she was shocked. They confronted him together. They’re both leaving him. Judy was devastated to hear they were taking Judy’s remaining ovary. Judy wants this baby. Judy can’t fathom terminating. He has a 3 year old and a 9 month old with her. He told Judy he wasn’t sure the infant was even his...obviously he is.

He says Judy’s having the baby out of spite. That Judy shouldn’t have the baby because Judy hates him. Judy’s forcing him to have a baby he doesn’t want. It’s so confusing because all he did was talk to Judy about how sad he was that the test last month was neg & how he would have taken care of Judy, he said he was sad about that because he wanted kids with Judy. This baby is a miracle.

AITA for keeping the baby and expecting him to keep his promises even if they aren’t together? It’s going to be so hard, Judy knows this, but Judy can’t have an abortion.

AITA for charging client full price for massage after a poop accident and she left for half hour? | Throwaway account, and not a shit post! (Pun intended lol)

Warning: this post may be gross.

Nick is a licensed massage therapist. Nick currently works at a spa, and Nick pays "rent" for his massage room. Before treatment Nick asks what areas they want focus on. This client,(F30s?), expressed she was having some pain in her lower back and glute(butt) muscles.
Nick leaves the room, and Nick told her to dress down to her comfort level.

This client booked for 1 hour massage. About 15 minutes into the massage, Nick tells her that Nick is going to pull back the sheet and start work on her lower back.

Now the gross part. The client wasn't wearing underwear, and when Nick pulled back the sheet there was brown liquid mush around her butt crack. This wasnt just a skid mark or not wiping very well, but the sheet now had what appeared to be poop on it. Runny yet sticky at the same time. The sheet was gross.

Nick has never been in this situation before, and Nick didn't want to embarrass her. Nick couldn't continue the massage, it would be a health hazard and it was smeared all over the sheet and some of her lower back. Nick said to her oh Nick is really sorry Nick thinks she might need to go to the washroom and clean up a little. Nick will give her a few minutes and let Nick know when she's ready. Nick left the room and heard her go into the washroom. 15 minutes have gone by and she hasn't come back out, so Nick knocks on the door and asks if she's okay. She responded Yes I'll be out in a minute. But that minute turned into another 15 minutes, so she was in there for a half hour! She came back out and Nick continued for 15 mins. When Nick finished, Nick left the room for her to get dressed and met her up at the counter to pay.

This where Nick is wondering if Nick is TA. Nick charged her the full amount for the massage, because she books the one hour time slot, and Nick had another client after her so Nick couldn't exactly run late. She got really mad saying she should pay half the price! Nick explains that Nick was sorry, but the hour was booked for her and it would be the same if somebody was late, they would still have to pay the full price of the time slot that they booked. She started yelling at Nick at the front desk saying how unprofessional Nick was. She eventually did pay, and later that day there was a review that she posted saying how Nick ripped her off and charged her more money than the actual massage.
Nick's partner said that Nick should have given the poor girl a break, she obviously was ill and Nick should have charged her half of the amount even if it meant Nick was losing money. Nick's coworker that Nick discusses this with said any other professional, like a counselor would be charging the full amount that's just what professionals do, and Nick is NTA.
So reddit, AITA?

Tl;dr: Nick's massage client had a poop accident on his sheets, went to the bathroom for a half hour and Nick still charged her the full amount for the massage she booked.

Nick yelled at his stepmother? | This happened a few months back, Nick just wanted to get the opinion of others on this matter since Nick still thinks about this moment quite a lot.

Some backstory: in 2016 Nick's brother passed away because of a stomach sickness. Ever since then, they’ve laid his ashes to rest in the cemetery of their hometown. Nick's biological mother adorned the grave with little fences, plants, pretty gravel and such. It looks darling, and it makes her feel good to have something to keep neat as she visits.

Nick's stepmother thinks she's spiritual. She claims she can commune with spirits, though only does this when she’s drunk. Sometimes, she brought up Nick's brother, which Nick personally doubts since Nick's brother did not like her at all.

Cut to a few months into Nick living with his father and his stepmother. In the weekends, they would go out and come back drunk. Sometimes, they’d argue with one another, getting pretty loud when it was around 1am already. Nick had gotten used to this behaviour to a certain degree and usually tried to sleep through it. This night, however, they were being particularly loud.

When Nick woke up, he heard his father telling his stepmother that she had no business at ‘his grave’. Still being groggy, Nick opened his door (first floor, they were on ground level) to listen in on their fight. The fight proceeded with Nick's stepmother lecturing Nick's father about what he does at Nick's brother’s grave, which was supposedly reminisce about the past, and how it would keep his spirit here. Nick's father told her that even if that was the case, she had no business with touching his grave.

Nick listened in for a bit more and heard more about Nick's stepmother telling Nick's father for only thinking about the past with Nick's brother and not ‘telling him’ about the future. And because she felt like Nick's mother has ‘trapped his spirit’ by putting the little fences around his grave, she removed them and threw them away.

This is when Nick snapped. What manner of thinking allows her to mess with the grave of Nick's brother, who didn’t even like her to begin with? Nick did not go to directly confront her, but Nick yelled at her as loud as he could from the first floor, how she was to disrespect and chastise their family, Nick's brother, like that.

Nick slammed his door shut. Immediately, everything went quiet. Shortly afterwards, Nick's stepmother went into the car and drove off. It wasn’t until two weeks after that they were on speaking terms again. According to Nick's father, Nick's outrage had hurt her quite a bit. Nick told him that Nick likes there is a certain line you can’t step over, no matter intentions.

Even if she thought that the decorations she assumed were ‘trapping the spirit of Nick's brother’, the least she could have done was to bring her concerns up with both Nick's father and Nick's mother, who have the most right to worry over his grave. Yet, in a drunken fit, she simply drove up there, took the fences away and drove off again.

AITA? Or did she cross a line? character limit so not as big as Nick wanted it.

AITA for forcing his wife to get rid of one of their cats? | Nick personally is not a fan of big blocks of text. So Nick is going to keep this as short as possible.

Nick and his wife have been together for almost 7 years (married 8 months). When they started dating they both lived at home and his wife's family has always had cats, where Nick's family were dog people. They moved in together 3-4 years into dating, to a place that didn't allow dogs but allowed cats. Nick was adamant he didn't want a cat, but deep down he knew his wife would be over the moon if they adopted one from their local shelter. So for their first Christmas living together, Nick surprised her and gave his wife some cat food and food dishes to unwrap. Nick told his wife to go adopt the cat she wanted and Nick would pay for everything, including the pet deposit at their apartment. His wife was so excited she cried.

Fast forward to summer 2018. They live in their newly purchased home and are set to be married in September. Nick's wife's sister brings over an abandoned kitten (approximately 2-3 weeks old) that was covered in dirt and oil from being stuck God knows where. Nick gets home from work and sees the cat there and immediately tells his wife that they aren't keeping him. But as the night went on, every time Nick looked at his soon to be wife her eyes were saying "pleassssse" without her actually saying anything at all. So of course Nick gave in and they kept the cat. On the condition that his wife makes sure their house is well kept and doesn't smell like cats.

They did the right thing and took him to the vet. Only to find out that he has an abnormal heart/possible heart disease. The vet says when he becomes an adult, his heart will not be able to keep up with his size and he will essentially just... drop dead. They were upset, but determined to give him the best life possible with what time he has left.

Here is problem. He is an asshole of a cat. He terrorizes their older cat to the point where she hates being in the same room as him. He constantly is leaving scabs on her. She feels forced to sleep in extremely high locations that are currently out of his reach, just to get some alone time. Worst of all, he is pissing every where and their house stinks. Nick is embarrassed to have anyone over. Having him fixed to combat his spraying isn't an option due to his heart condition. Nick finally had it with everything and told his wife to get rid of him. Nick loves their first cat much more, and her life is reduced to hiding from him. But selfishly the biggest reason Nick wants him gone is because he is making their house a pig sty. The smell hits you as soon as you open the back door.

Nick is not looking for advice. Mainly because nothing is going to change his mind. Nick just was curious what everyone had to say because his wife is fairly upset about having to get rid of him.

AITA for being embarrassed Judy's boyfriend called out a wedding party at a 9/11 memorial? | So off the bat, Judy agrees with Nick's sentiments but disagrees on the way Nick handled it. Judy's boyfriend and Judy, along with Judy's sister and her SO, were out for Judy's birthday, walking around a park.  At this park there’s a large 9/11 memorial that lists all the names of the people who died and has a somber feel to it, however it’s also in a sunny spot in a beautiful public park.

Judy's boyfriend mentioned how some people have started taking their wedding photos in front of the memorial, and how it’s becoming an issue because it’s disrespectful; people have posted wedding photos at the memorial with all the names photoshopped out. Judy's sister and her SO agreed and noted that the memorial in their city also has lots of people taking silly selfies and stuff that’s not appropriate for what it is.As they walked back, they noticed a wedding party (including the bride in her wedding dress, groom, kids, parents, the full party) in front of the memorial, taking photos. They couldn't walk through the memorial because of the photo-taking, so they went around.

As they were about to come up on them, Judy's sister’s SO and Judy's boyfriend started joking (so they thought) about confronting the party or making them feel bad for using the site. Judy's sister and Judy both begged them not to, but in a slightly joking tone (they were laughing and smiling) because they didn't think they were serious. Then as they passed, Judy's sister’s SO stayed quiet but Judy's boyfriend went up to them and yelled out “It’s a 9/11 memorial, you shouldn’t be taking those pictures here!” or something along those lines. Judy couldn’t remember clearly as Judy felt so embarrassed and kept walking. Nick didn’t linger or confront anyone directly, and by the time Judy glanced back Nick was already walking away from them.  Judy isn’t sure how much the wedding party understood what was going on, but they definitely looked confused/concerned momentarily and stared at them as they passed. Luckily there was no further confrontation. Judy's sister and Judy basically power walked away from them.

Afterwards, Judy's sister and Judy basically felt it was rude and didn’t accomplish anything besides put a damper on someone’s special day, but Judy's boyfriend disagreed and seemed happy with what Nick did (and Judy's sister’s SO agreed with Nick). Judy has never been embarrassed like that at something Nick’s done and Judy feels kind of bad Judy wasn’t able to be supportive - instead Judy just disagreed with Nick while not even directly facing Nick and then abruptly stopped talking about it. So, was Judy's boyfriend rude, or did Nick do the right thing and Judy should support it? Did the wedding party deserve to be berated or are they free to take pictures wherever?

**TL;DR: Judy's boyfriend berated a wedding party for taking wedding photos a 9/11 memorial site, Judy was left super embarrassed and felt it was rude, but Nick disagrees and stands by his actions.**

WIBTA if Nick did not let his sibling eat animal products in Nick's home? | For background, Nick's SO and Nick are both vegan and have been for 2 and a half years. There are many reasons why, including the typical reasons, but Nick has allergies to animal products which are avoided in a vegan diet so it's like getting two birds stoned at once. Nick's sibling is twice Nick's age (Nick is in his 20s) and both were born in the same country but Nick grew up in a western country and his sibling still lives in the same country.

Nick's sibling will be visiting Nick's SO and Nick in the near future and they are excited for her to visit. But... they are on the opposite sides of the dietary spectrum. Inevitably, the food conversation came up. They expect her to eat vegan with them but she doesn't want to budge. She will be spending a few days with some extended relatives who eat meat-heavy so in Nick's opinion, she won't miss out. Nick doesn't have any issue with his sibling using her own money to buy animal products but she wants to accompany the meals they cook with animal products and doesn't want to eat "fake meat" which Nick understands. They don't really buy meat-alternatives unless they are with omnivores at a BBQ or something. Also, Nick does not want her to use Nick's utensils or pans or sponges or sinks because of Nick's allergies. For example, Nick has a "typical" dairy allergy which is the most prominent one and while it's only "serious" if Nick ingests any, even touching dairy will give Nick major hives. Her other compromise is to only have dairy and eggs but those are still animal products and dairy allergy aside, they aren't comfortable with those being in their home.

Nick's SO and Nick are not comfortable with buying any animal products for her as it goes against their own beliefs. Nick's sibling is not paying for any part of her visit which Nick doesn't mean to hold over her head or anything but it means that they would be breaking their own morals for her comfort since they'd be buying her food for the majority of her trip. She has pointed out that they buy animal products for their pets but Nick personally does not believe in imposing his diet on obligate carnivores that they chose to adopt. Animals are viewed differently in her culture which Nick acknowledges but Nick doesn't believe humans will die from a few days of eating no animal products. They want her to be as comfortable as possible and acknowledge that her cultural experience with food is different from their own but Nick's sibling and Nick cannot find a good resolution or compromise. WIBTA if Nick didn't budge and just fed her vegan food for the days she is staying with them?

AITA for being upset that Judy's mom is trying to pay Judy and Judy's fiancé to read the Bible? | Backstory: Judy is currently 22 and lives with Judy's fiancé (also 22) in their own apartment. Both were raised Christian although they had very different experiences. Neither identifies as Christian anymore and religion isn’t something that either really cares about or enjoys talking about.

Judy's mother on the other hand is a devout born again Christian and has a tendency to ask Judy really direct questions that Judy doesn’t enjoy talking to her about (example: in high school she used to ask Judy if Judy was a lesbian just out of the blue from time to time since Judy didn’t have a boyfriend). Well, a few years back this lead to her just asking Judy if Judy still believed in god to which Judy told her that Judy didn’t really know and that Judy didn’t want to discuss it further. Judy's mother freaked out and started crying and has occasionally tried to convert Judy ever since.

Well, this weekend Judy's mother came to visit Judy for Judy's birthday. It was the first time Judy has seen her in about a year so Judy was pretty excited. When Judy's mother got there everything was fine but on the second night of the stay she says she has a birthday present for Judy and then proceeds to hand Judy Judy's old bible (which Judy told her she could keep multiple times). Then Judy's mother tells Judy to open it. When Judy does, there are two $100 checks- one for Judy and one for Judy's fiancé. Judy's mother told Judy that they each need to read the book of John and then they can cash the checks.

Now, Judy has nothing against any religion. Judy is a firm believer that people should be able to do or practice whatever they want as long as they are not harming others. But personally, Judy wants nothing to do with this. Judy feels offended that Judy's mother would bring that book into Judy's home and then try to pay Judy and Judy's fiancé to read it. But Judy also doesn’t know what to do with it. Judy can’t just throw it away so now Judy feels stuck with it. Judy still wants the $200 so Judy is also probably going to read it despite feeling like Judy is going against Judy's own beliefs by doing so. So Reddit, Judy is not really sure where Judy stands with this.

AITA for being upset with Judy's mom for doing this? It seems petty to Judy when Judy reads it back so Judy feels guilty being bothered by it. Judy's fiancé was pretty excited at the possibility of an easy $100 but Judy is upset about it.

AITA for texting the group chat about a used tampon sitting out in our bathroom? | Nick currently lives in a house with 3 other roommates. All of them are in college. The 3 girls Nick lives with are fucking gross, to put it lightly. They are all best friends as well, so Nick thinks they kind of enable each other. They do not clean up after themselves and they completely neglect things like dishes, cleaning up after parties, etc. It's only for the semester that Nick lives there, thank the lord.

Recently, Nick was in the shower and noticed a used tampon on the side of the shower. It's totally bloody and engorged from the shower water, and the blood is dripping down into the shower. Gross.

So, after getting out of the shower Nick realized no one was home. Nick thought a lot about how he wanted to address it, and decided to text this exactly in the house group chat: "Hi, someone left something in the shower. They should clean it up as soon as possible."

Fast forward to later, people had presumably come home and whoever it was took care of it.

The next day, one of the girls asked to talk to Nick. She basically told Nick that all 3 of them had separately looked in the shower trying to figure out if it was them that 'left something,' and that, through process of elimination, it was figured out who the culprit was. She kind of condescendingly told Nick that she understands where he was coming from but that Nick really embarrassed the girl that did it (even though Nick still doesn't know who did it, he supposes it's now a secret between them). In return, Nick told her that his intention was not to embarrass anyone, that it was unsanitary, and if she was suggesting Nick clean it up instead. She told Nick she's not quite suggesting that but that Nick really shouldn't have addressed everyone about it.

Nick didn't apologize and told her that he did what he thought was appropriate. However, Nick is now wondering if he was in the wrong for how he handled it. Nick asked his mother and she said Nick should have just cleaned it up, but Nick's mother has relatively poor judgment and will avoid confrontation at all costs.

AITA for addressing the issue in the group chat than handling it in some other way?

**TL;DR:** There was a used tampon in the shower. Nick texted the group chat about it without actually saying what it was. Nick was confronted and told he really embarrassed the girl who did it and should have handled it differently.

AITA for not picking up "Nick's" dog's poop? | Nick is 16 and in foster care. He is immunocompromised, and has a chronic immune system condition that he has to take daily medication for. Nick's social worker gave Nick and Nick's also immunocompromised childhood friend with the same condition who is in the same area now proper masks and gloves a few months ago, which Nick uses whenever he is outside or his friend comes over.

Nick doesn't love his current place, but it was his only option. Nick's foster parents have two younger kids with them too that Nick has to help out with. They also have two very large and frequently aggressive Rottweiler looking dogs that are mostly kept tied up in the back yard that Nick has to do about 90% of the care and walks for. The adults are rarely home as they also have a severely disabled child that has a lot of emergencies.

Nick will be honest. He doesn't like dogs or understand them, and he may actually be allergic. Aside from the small fluffy ones, they scare him. He is also much smaller for his age, so he can't really physically do the care anyway. He has to have his friend come help for walks. Nick's friend is stronger than Nick and can get them to submit enough and tie them up properly at least.

As part of their condition, they can't handle fecal matter, especially animal fecal matter, at all. In a few years maybe, not not now, which is sad, because Nick does like cats. They could end up in the hospital for things that most people can shake off in days. Even changing a diaper right now would be an intense procedure. English isn't their first language, so their doctors gave them medical notes that they can show when they need to explain.

Obviously, on these walks, they struggle to control them, but the larger complaint from neighbors is that they poop everywhere. They've tried to explain the issue and why they don't have a choice in walking them, and why they absolutely cannot clean up after them, but the complaints about it keep coming. They also complain about their care in general, but they can't do anything about that either. They can't just run free, they're dangerous and hate kids. But the larger issue is the poop. Animal services never did anything before and wouldn't come out now, and Nick can't call or he'd get into huge trouble and potentially end up in a much more dangerous situation.

AITA?

Was Nick the asshole for leading the prayer in class despite being openly atheist? Nick is 25F, a grad student. For this story, it is important to disclose that his country is predominantly Roman Catholic, the grad school Nick currently attends is Catholic, but Nick is openly atheist and has been one since Nick was 11 years old.

Earlier today was Nick's first meeting for this subject, the heaviest major units wise for the semester. Nick's professor (70M, religious, is known to have opening and closing prayer every period) made eye contact with Nick and asked Nick to lead the opening prayer. Despite being an atheist, Nick led the prayer and said a safe Our Father (Nick memorizes the prayers because Nick studied in Catholic schools and Nick's family is Catholic)

The reason why Nick did this was because Nick didn’t want to risk a possible negative reaction, interrogation, or debate with his professor which could ruin the professor's impression of the class. You know how some old religious people view atheism as subversive and wrong especially in a predominantly Catholic country like Nick's. Nick wasn’t forced to lead the prayer, but Nick just sucked it up and did it anyway since Nick felt that reciting an opening prayer for one minute outweighed the possible consequences to the class if Nick's professor reacted negatively to Nick declining to lead the prayer due to Nick's atheism.

A few hours after, one of Nick's classmates calls Nick out and says that they felt offended at what Nick did because Nick knowingly disrespected the Catholic faith by reducing solemn and holy prayers into a meaningless vocalization. They say that prayers should always be said with meaning and that Nick shouldn’t have led the prayer when Nick is not a spiritual person and doesn’t even believe in God. They say that only Catholics should lead the prayer as a respect for the faith.

Nick explained to them why Nick did what Nick did (same explanation as above), that Nick was put on the spot, but they still insist Nick is in the wrong and that Nick still shouldn’t have led the prayer since Nick is an atheist.

Nick shared this story with Nick's friends and has garnered mixed feedback. Was Nick the asshole?

TLDR: Prof asked Nick to lead the opening prayer, Nick is atheist but led the prayer anyway since Nick didn’t want to risk having the prof negatively react if Nick declined. Classmate called Nick out and said that Nick disrespected their faith by doing that. Was Nick the asshole?

AITA for refusing to let Nick's 10-year-old daughter out of the bathroom until she washed her hands thoroughly? | Alright so, Nick's 10-year-old daughter has a real problem with washing her hands. She has some developmental disabilities, hates showers and washing her hands, but she still understands why she needs to clean herself and why it’s important. These past few weeks, Nick had noticed that the underside of her fingernails are caked with dirt and who-knows-what. When she gets close, Nick gets whiffs of garbage and sewage. Nick has no idea why she’s not embarrassed by this, he’s sure kids at school have noticed. Nick has sent her to go wash her hands several times and it just doesn’t work. Her mother will say “oh, but her disabilities” as though this is something she doesn’t have to learn.

Yesterday, Nick snapped and dragged her over to the bathroom. Nick showed her the soap and a nail brush and demonstrated how to thoroughly wash her hands. Nick refused to let her out of the bathroom until she’d scrubbed her hands clean to his satisfaction. She started crying and whining that Nick was being mean and unfair, but he was firm on it. Finally, after she scrubbed her hands several times, she showed Nick that they were clean. Nick said, “That wasn’t so bad, right? If you do it often it won’t even take that long.” She nodded, Nick gave her a hug, and that was that.

Nick's wife came up to him and started screaming at Nick for imprisoning their daughter and treating her like she was a 3-year-old. They've had so many disagreements over this. Nick said that she was treating their daughter like a child for not enforcing rules just because she has some disabilities, and asked her if she wanted their daughter to grow up to be a functional adult or not. Nick's wife said “Nick abused and terrified her, if she was smart she would take her and leave” and Nick told her if that is what she wants, fine, but Nick has their daughter’s best interests at heart.

AITA?

AITA for not wanting to baptize Nick's baby? | TLDR at the end. Mobile so sorry if anything looks weird.

Nick and his fiance both agreed they didn't plan on baptizing their baby. Nick's parents are pretty pissed about this, especially Nick's dad, and started an argument with him over it.

They asked why they weren't getting her baptized and Nick said it's because they're not religious so they don't see the point. Nick mentioned that if she decides she wants to be baptized when she's older then that's fine with him. Nick's parents argued that they're all Catholic since they were baptized so she should be baptized as well. Nick said again that his fiance and he both aren't Catholic so they're not doing it to which Nick's dad replied that since they were baptized they ARE Catholic, they're just not practicing Catholics.

Nick told them again that he doesn't believe in God and they're not religious so until their daughter decided for herself they weren't doing it. Nick's dad said "well what if you're wrong? I won't even say what would happen then". Then Nick's mom made some insane comment about "where do you think humans came from?" and "if we evolved don't you think they would've found fish dna in humans years ago?".
